fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Structured data chunk containing descriptive metadata about the file to which it is post-pended, virtually always an MP3_FF (MP3 sound file). Referred to by its creators as an "informal standard," ID3v1 permits the identification of title, artist, date, genre, etc. See Notes for more information.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Version 1 partially documented. Developed by Martin Nilsson and colleagues, whose ID3.org web site is now strongly oriented to ID3v2, version 2.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: Documentation for version 1 available at ID3.org and Doug's AppleScripts for iTunes.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Very widely adopted for World Wide Web dissemination and playback on specialized devices.

fdd:magicNumbers.fdd:note: See 3DI marker information in Notes below.

fdd:general.p: ID3v1 binary content is structured as "frames" just like MP3_ENC (MP3 audio encoding). Version 1 is limited to 125 bytes of data; four tags are limited to 30 bytes, one to 4 bytes, and the genre tag to a one-byte code.

When ID3 metadata is placed in a MP3_FF file, established conventions call for the use of the ID3 marker which consists of the string "3DI". For ID3v1, the marker is positioned 10 bytes preceding the metadata. For ID3v2 data, the marker is positioned in the first 3 bytes of the file when the metadata is pre-pended and 10 bytes from the end of a file when it is post-pended.
